article.title: Starting and stopping Sync Gateway
article.description: Learn how to start and stop Sync Gateway.
article.introduction: This article explains how to start and stop Sync Gateway.

body.paragraph: You start Sync Gateway by running the executable file sync_gateway from the command line:
body.note: For convenience, you can add the bin directory that contains the executable file to your PATH environment variable.
body.paragraph: In the command above, neither a configuration file nor command-line options were specified. In this case, default values are used. The command above starts a Sync Gateway instance and connects to the built-in, in-memory database Walrus. Sync Gateway listens on port 4984 for Sync API commands, and listens on port 4985 for Admin API commands.

For information about the configuration file, see the article Configuration properties. For information about command-line options, see the article Command-line options.
In the case of maintenance or for other operations, you can stop Sync Gateway by typing Control-C. There is no specific shutdown procedure and it is safe to stop Sync Gateway at any time.
